Stakeholder: Biological Weapons Convention Implementation Support Unit (BWC ISU)
Overall role: Solve problems with the implementation and enforcement of the Biological Weapons Convention (BWC).
Role in DBE: Responsible for requesting an investigation into a breach of the BWC; would assist States facing a hazardous exposure as a result of a violation of the BWC.
Mandates: Biological Weapons Convention,Biological Weapons Convention Conference VI
Triggers: Request for assistance by the UN Security Council after a request is made to them by a government as outlined in Article VII of the BWC

Overall role: R&D and development of novel drugs, vaccines, and diagnostic tools.
Role in DBE: R&D and development of novel drugs, vaccines, and diagnostic tools. Based on company-specific mandate, would be involved if there was a need for development or distribution of novel diagnostic tests or other relevant materials.
Triggers: Based on company-specific mandate, would be involved in there was a need for additional telecommunication support in the impacted area

Overall role: Finance and coordinate the development of new vaccines to prevent and contain infectious disease epidemics.
Role in DBE: Leverage existing capabilities and partnerships against new epidemic diseases.
Organization's Mission: Organizational Policy Creation and Management Policy.pdf (https://v5.airtableusercontent.com/v3/u/45/45/1757448000000/kAdo9W151fg5gfPoXOeCNA/IiiRZzOsb_TPH5y-jQpxySld8mRa3Ezw_fqXk-ldVGTLh0vYbS8D2NqjFDAsbMIL--6a1B46N5VtKSHSkPiNTgamRkHfQuvUywe50hXX76BJTJUhWSgxn-Wvw576rA-ijz95uA3Gz2pBtNqXGxI5erYK4VMpJevx3dg4WGb2BpQop4XghBqjW50bj8QGnXjgMdgxEaBU5n_HFbpJWUbO5g/9YHZE3dZ3aQMzXvki-ImX-h-mjvHlGTxlhRFhkwcba0)

Overall role: Strengthen coordination and coherence of counter-terrorism efforts of the United Nations system
Role in DBE: Build capacity to prevent and combat terrorism.

Stakeholder: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
Overall role: Support policies and political commitments that promote food security. Upon request, FAO could, possibly also in coordination with other agencies, assess the effects of the deliberate biological event on agricultural production and food safety and provide advice on counter measures needed.
Role in DBE: Support policies and political commitments that promote food security. Upon request, FAO could, possibly also in coordination with other agencies, assess the effects of the deliberate biological event on agricultural production and food safety and provide advice on counter measures needed.
Triggers: Request from any UN member State or request from UN Secretary General

Overall role: Improve access to new and underused vaccines for children living in the world’s poorest countries.
Role in DBE: Fund emergency routine vaccine introductions, an emergency stockpile, and preventive vaccination campaigns.

Stakeholder: Global Health Security Alliance Private Sector Round Table (GHSA PSRT)
Overall role: The mission of the Private Sector Roundtable is to mobilize industry to helpcountries prevent, detect and respond to health-related crises, and strengthensystems for health security.
Role in DBE: Support global supply network to address public health emergencies with necessary products and equipment; provide expert assistance and technological and public health support.
Triggers: Upon request

Overall role: Advise States and airlines of any potential risks to civil aviation and scheduled services.
Role in DBE: Advise States and airlines of any potential risks to civil aviation and scheduled services.
Mandates: Cooperative Arrangement for the Prevention of Spread of Communicable Disease through Air Travel (CAPSCA)
Triggers: Affected State Command and Control compromised

Stakeholder: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)
Overall role: Impartial, neutral and independent organization whose exclusively humanitarian mission is to protect the lives and dignity of victims of armed conflict and other situations of violence and to provide them with assistance.
Role in DBE: Would only be involved in response activities if the DBE takes place in conflict affected area where the ICRC is already active.
Mandates: Resolutions of the International Conferences of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies,Geneva Conventions of 1949

Overall role: Serve as the worldwide information hub for law enforcement cooperation; deliver policing capabilities that support member countries to fight and prevent transnational crimes; consolidate resources and governance structures for enhanced operational performance.
Role in DBE: Provide support to national law enforcement authorities with criminal investigation and fact gathering.
Triggers: Request from any Member State

Overall role: Responsible for the safety of life at sea, maritime security, and the protection of the marine environment through prevention of sea pollution caused by ships.
Role in DBE: The Maritime Safety Committee (MSC) would enforce standards for health in ports and on ships; would also play a role in handling stowaways should individuals seek to leave a country in this manner.
Triggers: DBE involved in a port State; refugees flee a country as stowaways

Overall role: Provide assistance to national governments across a variety of roles, including both humanitarian and providing public health services and medical care.
Role in DBE: Provide assistance to national governments across a variety of roles, including both humanitarian and providing public health services and medical care.
Triggers: Request from state for assistance; NGO determines their assistance is necessary

Overall role: Provide assistance to displaced/migrant populations, camp management, humanitarian border management.
Role in DBE: Provide assistance to displaced/migrant populations, camp management, humanitarian border management in response to any population displacement resulting from the DBE.

Stakeholder: Joint United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP)/OCHA Environment Unit (JEU)
Overall role: Respond to environmental emergencies by coordinating international efforts and mobilizing partners to assist affected countries requesting assistance. Upon request, support the assessment of the incident's impact (environment, human and livelihood).
Role in DBE: Respond to environmental emergencies by coordinating international efforts and mobilizing partners to assist affected countries requesting assistance. Upon request, support the assessment of the incident's impact (environment, human and livelihood).
Triggers: Request from State for assistance

Overall role: Conduct diagnostic testing and identify unknown agent.
Role in DBE: Conduct diagnostic testing and identify unknown agent.
Mandates: National regulations and policies,local regulations and policies
Triggers: Case identified

Overall role: Provide assistance to local governments across a variety of roles, including both humanitarian and providing public health services and medical care.
Role in DBE: First providers on the ground of humanitarian, medical and logistical support during the crisis. In contrast to international NGOs, local NGO workers would be allowed to remain on the ground and respond to the crises.
Triggers: Case identified

Overall role: National governments who are not impacted by an event may provide support to affected national governments.
Role in DBE: Provide support to affected national governments.
Triggers: Request for assistance from affected government or from UN

Overall role: Develop and execute federal laws related to farming, agriculture, forestry, and food.
Role in DBE: Coordinate with other countries and food

Stakeholder: programs to ensure the country has access to safe

Overall role: First case in animals identified by veterinary professionals
Create infrastructure to promote economic growth, technological competitiveness, and sustainable development.
Role in DBE: Determine whether any markets will be largely affected by a DBE, coordinate efforts to minimize the damage of a DBE to commerce.
Triggers: First case in animals

Overall role: Plan, promote, coordinate, and oversee environmental programs at the national level.
Role in DBE: Assess situation to evaluate any expected environmental impacts.
Triggers: Case identified

Overall role: Work to improve the health, safety, and well-being of the country.
Role in DBE: Assess the situation and coordinates disaster response, mobilizes Public Health Emergency Operation Center.
Triggers: First case in humans identified by medical professionals

Overall role: Provide nonpartisan, objective guidance for decision makers on pressing issues.
Role in DBE: Advise governments, contribute to the work of non-governmental organizations, and inform the public about scientific and technical issues related to international security and biological weapons.

Overall role: Protect national interests, supports national security and defense.
Role in DBE: Protect responders in a public health emergency.
Triggers: Case identified

Stakeholder: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
Overall role: Investigate of alleged uses of chemical weapons and assistance and protection against such use. Would not have a direct involvement in the response to a deliberate biological event, but would provide technical assistance and share acquired experience to the agencies responsible for responding to the event.
Role in DBE: Would not have a direct involvement in the response to a deliberate biological event, but would provide technical assistance and share acquired experience to the agencies responsible for responding to the event.
Mandates: Chemical Weapons Convention (Articles IX-X),UN General Assembly Resolution 55/283
Triggers: No direct involvement, but would likely provide technical assistance to other agencies responsible for responding to DBE

Overall role: R&D and production of novel drugs and vaccines.
Role in DBE: R&D and production of drugs and vaccines. Based on company-specific mandate, would be involved if there was a need for development or distribution of medical countermeasures.
Triggers: Based on company-specific mandate, would be involved if there was a need for development or distribution of medical countermeasures or other relevant materials

Overall role: Triage patients and provide patient care in private clinics and hospitals. Healthcare providers may include physicians, nurses, community health workers, traditional healers, and other professionals involved in the provision of medical care.
Role in DBE: Triage patients and provide patient care in private clinics and hospitals. Healthcare providers may include physicians, nurses, community health workers, traditional healers, and other professionals involved in the provision of medical care.
Mandates: National regulations and policies,Local regulations and policies
Triggers: Case identified

Overall role: Triage patients and provide patient care in public clinics, hospitals, and other public health facilities. Healthcare providers may include physicians, nurses, community health workers, traditional healers, and other professionals involved in the provision of medical care.
Role in DBE: Triage patients and provide patient care in public clinics, hospitals, and other public health facilities. Healthcare providers may include physicians, nurses, community health workers, traditional healers, and other professionals involved in the provision of medical care.
Mandates: National regulations and policies,Local regulations and policies
Triggers: Case identified

Overall role: Monitor criminal activity to protect people

Organization category: Protect responders in a public health emergency.
Overall role: National regulations and policies
Role in DBE: Mobilization of responders

Overall role: Extend the benefits of immunization to all people through three strategic ambitions: enabling vaccine access and uptake, advancing vaccine knowledge and innovation, and researching and developing new vaccines.
Role in DBE: Leverage experience, capabilities and partnerships to tackle challenges around access and uptake of existing vaccines, and research and development of new vaccines.

Overall role: Provide telecommunication support to field workers, NGOs, and governments.
Role in DBE: Provide telecommunication support to field workers, NGOs, and governments.
Triggers: Based on company-specific mandate, would be involved in there was a need for additional telecommunication support in the impacted area

Overall role: Member States may request assistance directly from the UN General Assembly, the policy-making and representative organ of the UN.
Role in DBE: Member States may request assistance directly from the UN General Assembly, the policy-making and representative organ of the UN.
Mandates: UN General Assembly Resolution 42/37C,UN General Assembly Resolution 55/283
Triggers: Request from any UN member State (suspicion of deliberate use)

Overall role: Advocate for the protection of children's rights, to help meet their basic needs and to expand their opportunities to reach their full potential.
Role in DBE: Support response and recovery activities, with an emphasis on providing services to children and families

Stakeholder: United Nations Department for Safety and Security (UNDSS)
Overall role: Provide professional safety and security services to UN personnel
Role in DBE: Provide professional safety and security services to UN personnel working to respond to the DBE.
Triggers: Deployment of UN personnel

Stakeholder: United Nations Department of Public Information (UNDPI)
Overall role: Promote global awareness and understanding of the work of the United Nations; provide internal and external communication support.
Role in DBE: Provide internal and external communication support and assistance to UN personnel.
Triggers: Based on its institutional mandate and/or based on a request by the UNSG

Stakeholder: United Nations Disaster Assessment and Coordination (UNDAC)
Overall role: Deploy at short notice (12-48 hours) anywhere in the world. UNDAC teams are are provided free of charge to a disaster-affected country, and deployed upon the request of the United Nations Resident or Humanitarian Coordinator and/or the affected Government.
Role in DBE: Mobilized by OCHA to help coordinate response and provide support to the affected government; help coordinate the humanitarian actors on the ground and the inter-cluster mechanism.
Triggers: Upon request specific request and mobilized by OCHA

Stakeholder: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)
Overall role: Assist refugees fleeing violence and war seek asylum and find safe refuge.
Role in DBE: Assist those fleeing the country in which a DBE occurred to find safe refuge in another State.
Mandates: UN General Assembly Resolution 428(V),UN General Assembly Resolution 58/153
Triggers: The High Commissioner recognizes a situation with refugees who fall within a defined scope

Stakeholder: United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research (UNIDIR)
Overall role: Assist the international community in finding and implementing solutions to disarmament and security challenges; provide data on problems relating to international security.
Role in DBE: Assist the international community in finding and implementing solutions to disarmament and security challenges; provide data on problems relating to international security.
Mandates: UNIDIR Statute (39th session of the UNGA)
Triggers: Request for research

Stakeholder: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR)
Overall role: Coordinate disaster reduction efforts and work to promote synergies among the disaster reduction activities of the United Nations system and regional actors.
Role in DBE: Manage disaster reduction activities and work to promote an efficient and coordinated response across international, national, and regional organizations.
Mandates: UN General Assembly Resolution 56/195,UN General Assembly Resolution 61/198
Triggers: Request for assistance from affected government

Stakeholder: United Nations Interregional Crime and Justice Research Institute (UNICRI)
Overall role: Work to advance understanding of crime-related problems, foster just and efficient criminal justice systems, support the respect of international instruments and standards, and facilitate international law enforcement cooperation and judicial assistance.
Role in DBE: Assists intergovernmental, governmental and non-governmental organizations in formulating and implementing policies relating to crime prevention and criminal justice.
Mandates: ECOSOC Res/1989/56,UN General Assembly Resolution 44/72,Milan Plan of Action
Triggers: No direct involvement, but would likely be consulted when determining attribution

Stakeholder: United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs (UNODA)
Overall role: Promote nuclear disarmament and nonproliferation; strengthen the disarmament regimes in respect to other weapons of mass destruction (including chemical and biological weapons); would be the party responsible for requesting an investigation into a breach of the BWC; would assist States facing a hazardous exposure as a result of a violation of the BWC.
Role in DBE: Responsible for requesting an investigation into a breach of the BWC; would assist States facing a hazardous exposure as a result of a violation of the BWC.
Mandates: Biological Weapons Convention,Biological Weapons Convention Conference VI,UN General Assembly Resolution 55/283
Triggers: Biological Weapons Convention Articles VI and VII; Biological Weapons Convention Conference VI WP.7

Stakeholder: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)
Overall role: Mobilize and coordinate effective and principled humanitarian action during disaster/emergencies, promote preparedness and prevention, and faciliate sustainable solutions
Role in DBE: Mobilize and coordinate effective and principled humanitarian action during disaster/emergencies, including identifying humanitarian assistance needs and assessing environmental impact
Mandates: UN General Assembly Resolution 46/182,UN General Assembly Resolution 60/124
Triggers: Request/consent by State

Overall role: Carry out prompt investigations in response to allegations brought to his attention concerning the possible use of chemical and bacteriological (biological) and toxin weapons.
Role in DBE: Through the United Nations Secretary-General's Mechanism (UNSGM), to appoint experts to undertake investigation of activities reported by UN member States.
Mandates: UN General Assembly Resolution 42/37C,UN Security Council Resolution 620 (1988)
Triggers: Request from any UN member State (suspicion of deliberate use)

Overall role: Carry out prompt investigations in response to allegations brought to the UN Secretary General's attention concerning the possible use of chemical and bacteriological (biological) and toxin weapons.
Role in DBE: Collect relevant data/information and perform analyses in order to ascertain facts related to the allegation of use, all of which are provided within a report to the Secretary General.
Mandates: UN General Assembly Resolution 42/37C,UN Security Council Resolution 620 (1988),Memorandum of Understanding between UNSGM and OIE,Memorandum of Understanding between UNSGM and WHO
Triggers: Request from any UN member State (suspicion of deliberate use)

Overall role: Facilitate implementation of resolution 1540 (2004) by all States. Could offer States technical expertise in drafting their reports to the 1540 Committee, and assistance preparing requests, and implementation planning, but only to the extent that its resources or voluntary contributions to the 1540 Committee allow.
Role in DBE: Facilitate implementation of resolution 1540 (2004) by all States. Could offer States technical expertise in drafting their reports to the 1540 Committee, and assistance preparing requests, and implementation planning, but only to the extent that its resources or voluntary contributions to the 1540 Committee allow.
Mandates: UN Security Council Resolution 1540 (2004),UN Security Council Resolution 1673 (2006),UN Security Council Resolution 1810 (2008),UN Security Council Resolution 1977 (2011),Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter
Triggers: Specific requests from other States

Overall role: Provide veterinary care at the local and regional levels.
Role in DBE: Provide veterinary care at the local and regional levels.
Mandates: National regulations and policies,Local regulations and policies
Triggers: First case in animals identified by veterinary professionals

Overall role: Provide financial and technical assistance to developing countries.
Role in DBE: Provide financial assistance to developing nations in their response efforts immediately following a DBE, and likely their rebuilding efforts following an event.
Triggers: Request for funds from an affected country

Overall role: Provide indirect support through the enforcement and compliance of Customs border regulations.
Role in DBE: Provide indirect support through the enforcement and compliance of Customs border regulations; promote exchange of information among Customs administrations.
Mandates: Convention to Establishing a Customs Co-operation Council (CCC)
Triggers: Request from Member State

Overall role: The World Economic Forum is committed to improving the state of the world by engaging business, political, academic and other leaders of society to shape global, regional and industry agendas.
Role in DBE: Would not be directly involved, but would likely provide expert advice and assistance on development on economic issues.
Triggers: Upon request

Overall role: Support UN efforts to end global hunger. Operations include saving lives in refugee crises and other emergencies, and improving nutrition and quality of life.
Role in DBE: Deliver food assistance, should the situation require it.
Triggers: Request for assistance from government

Overall role: Direct and coordinate international health incidents within the United Nations system; provide leadership with respect to health matters, disseminate knowledge, and provide technical support for healthcare fields; monitor and assess health trends.
Role in DBE: Provide leadership with respect to health matters, disseminate knowledge, and provide technical support for healthcare fields; monitor and assess health trends.
Mandates: International Health Regulations (IHR),World Health Assembly Resolution 34.26,World Health Assembly Resolution 46.6,Memorandum of Understanding between UNSGM and WHO,WHO Constitution,UN General Assembly Resolution 46/182,UN General Assembly Resolution 60/124,World Health Assembly Resolution 48.2,World Health Assembly Resolution 65.20,World Health Assembly Resolution 59.22,World Health Assembly Resolution 64.10
Triggers: Event is a public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC); Occurrence of an Emergency Response Framework (ERF) Grade-3 event; Request for assistance from government; Identification of a notifiable agent

Overall role: Intergovernmental organisation responsible for improving animal health worldwide.
Role in DBE: If the DBE impacted animal health, OIE would provide assistance to prevent or stop animal disease spread.
Mandates: OIE Organic Statutes,Memorandum of Understanding between UNSGM and OIE
Triggers: Request or consent from affected state; identification of a notifiable agent
